label: 313. T.S. Keith to James B. Heyward -- January 2, 1867
description: Letter from T.S. Keith to James B. Heyward concerning interest on a bond payable to Mr. Keith.  Mr. Keith outlines how he would like to be paid since he is now near destitute and is unable "to pay for my washing or to buy wood for my chamber."  A note at the end of the letter from James B. Heyward confirms that he has fulfilled the request.  1p. January 2, 1867.

Mr. Keith outlines how he would like to be paid since he is now near destitute and is unable "to pay for my washing or to buy wood for my chamber."  A note at the end of the letter from James B. metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: My dear James   Wm tells me to day, that you did not understand the plan I proposed for Brother- I will try, and explain my meaning-You owe me on the 1st of January, 1867 seven hundred Dollars for two years interest on my Bond- I wish you to deduct 400$ for the last two years that Brother has been with you, as some compensation for his expenses- Of the 300 then due- I request you to pay 100$ at this time, and the rest, 200,$ during the ensuing year in such sums, and at such times as will meet your convenience- You will excuse my making this request- when I tell you I am destitute- not being able to pay for my washing or to buy wood for my chamber- and Brother owes 5$ to the Hotel- and wants a Hat-   I am Yours Affly. T S Keith   Memorandum.  I replied to the above sending a draft upon Messr Wm C. Bee & Co for $100. and accepting a receipt of $500 on my bond to Mrs Keith   Jas. B. Heyward   Jan 2d 1867
